channel.title: Work History on Rusty Eddy
channel.description: Recent content in Work History on Rusty Eddy

item.title: Cisco Systems
item.description:
Original member of the Multicast Routing team. Team of 12 responsible for the design, implementation and testing the complete suite of Multicast Routing protocols for the Cisco Carrier Routing System (CRS). Worked this project from early design through product launch into maintenance.

Computer Networks, Multicast Routing, C/C++, Real Time, Distributed Systems

item.title: USC ~ ISI
item.description: Led the effort to add IGMP/PIM and Multicast Routing Information Base (MRIB) to the Open Source GateD suite of routing protocols. Mentored graduate students and others that would eventually become prominent members of the computer networking community.

item.title: Retix
item.description: Promoted to lead the team of 6 engineers that developed and automated test plans for L2 switches, OSPF, RIP and BGP Implemented an automated test framework and led junior engineers in developing the automated test suites. C; C++; Perl; TCL Provided 3rd level customer support, serious customer problems that could not be resolved by customer support or field engineers became my teams responsibility to diagnose and determine solutions and workarounds was required.

item.title: Rockwell, Intl. Space Systems Division
item.description:
Led a team of 5 Sysadmins responsible for the use and well being of Engineering Departments 300+ UNIX workstations, servers (Sun, HP, DEC) and network.

On a team that Developed a Real Time OS that was embedded in a variety of space and military projects.

item.title: California State University ~ Chancelors Office
item.description: I was hired to install and manage the departments first AT&T Unix Mini-computers, UUNET connection and write a bulletin board system for California State Educators.
